articles.title: OpenAI Eyes $500 Billion Valuation in Share Sale Talks | The Pulse 8/06/2025
articles.summary:
OpenAI¬†is in early talks about a potential sale of stock for current and former employees at a valuation of about $500 billion, people briefed on the investment discussions said, marking an enormous gain in value for the artificial intelligence leader. The company is targeting a secondary stock sale in the billions of dollars, the people said, asking to remain anonymous because they weren‚Äôt authorized to discuss the matter publicly. If the deal goes ahead, it would elevate OpenAI‚Äôs on-paper price tag by roughly two-thirds. In trade news, President Donald Trump said he‚Äôd impose increased tariffs on countries buying energy from Russia while clarifying that levies on semiconductor and pharmaceutical imports would be announced ‚Äúwithin the next week or so.‚Äù¬†
Today's guests: Kim Crawford, JPMorgan Asset Management Global Rates Portfolio Manager, Karsten Munk Knudsen, Novo Nordisk CFO (Source: Bloomberg)

articles.title: U.S. charges Chinese nationals with illegally exporting chips to China
articles.summary: Two Chinese nationals residing in California have been arrested and charged with violating export control laws by allegedly shipping advanced microchips used in artificial intelligence to China.

articles.title: US Considers More Chip Tariffs | Bloomberg Tech 8/5/2025
articles.summary: Bloomberg‚Äôs Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss President Donald Trump‚Äôs comments that more chip tariffs may be coming soon. Plus, booming demand for artificial intelligence led Palantir‚Äôs revenue to climb above $1 billion. And AMD is under pressure to show benefits from the AI race as the chipmaker prepares to release earnings after markets close. (Source: Bloomberg)
